body:
The fact that these functions are not supported in Android is best known by the implementation in `c_api.cc`, so having callers of that API attempt to _duplicate_ that information seems wrong. Put another way, the `#ifdef`s in `server_jni.cc` and `c_api.cc` need to be in sync, which seems unnecessary.

We do something similar for `TF_LoadSavedModel` in https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/cb6fc1dfea89d143faf4efe9083a6699a07602f5/tensorflow/c/c_api.cc#L2518 

We should follow that pattern here.
body_html:
The fact that these functions are not supported in Android is best known by the implementation in c_api.cc, so having callers of that API attempt to duplicate that information seems wrong. Put another way, the #ifdefs in server_jni.cc and c_api.cc need to be in sync, which seems unnecessary.

We do something similar for TF_LoadSavedModel in

tensorflow/tensorflow/c/c_api.cc

Line 2518 in cb6fc1d

#ifdef __ANDROID__

We should follow that pattern here.
body_text:

We do something similar for TF_LoadSavedModel in 
  
    
      tensorflow/tensorflow/c/c_api.cc
    
    
         Line 2518
      in
      cb6fc1d
    
    
    
    

        
          
           #ifdef __ANDROID__ 
        
    
  


We should follow that pattern here.
